thread.title: More Ratings: SVP SportsCenter, WNBA Finals, NASCAR Xfinity
thread.title_full: More Ratings: SVP SportsCenter, WNBA Finals, NASCAR Xfinity

author: Paulsen
title: More Ratings: SVP SportsCenter, WNBA Finals, NASCAR Xfinity
text: SVP SportsCenter on Par With Last Year Excluding postgame editions after Monday Night Football , the Scott Van Pelt -hosted Midnight ET edition of SportsCenter has averaged a 0.5 rating and 690,000 viewers thus far (16 telecasts) — flat in ratings and down 2% in viewership from a 0.5 and 703,000 last year (11 telecasts). (ESPN) Game 3 of WNBA Finals Down From Last Year, Up From ’13 Game 3 of the Lynx/Fever WNBA Finals drew 432,000 viewers on ESPN2 Friday night, down 28% from Mercury/Sky last year (602K) but up 35% from Lynx/Dream in 2013 (321K), both of which were series-clinchers. Lynx/Fever Game 3 in 2012 had 337,000. (via Sports TV Ratings ) NASCAR Xfinity Series Down at Charlotte NASCAR Xfinity Series racing from Charlotte drew 962,000 viewers on NBCSN Friday night, down 23% from last year (1.2M) and down 26% from 2013 (1.3M), both on ESPN2. Excluding rainouts, the race earned the third-smallest audience of the season. Nine of the ten least-watched races have aired on NBCSN. (via Sports TV Ratings) Related
